page.title: 12ST.MARY'S CHURCH EDGEWORTH.
page.content: The church was started in{Saxon}times then it was rebuilt by the{Normans}who lengthened the{nave}and added the {chapel.}The large square{tower}was added to the western end in the 14th century,also the{porch.}The church is built of{Cotswold stone}with a stone tile roof.It has a variety of{Norman {and Early English,Decorated and Tudor {windows.}Inside it has{wooden pews,a {modern screen, a 15 th century font {and stone communion rail in front of {the altar.}The church yard has lots of graves, some{special grave stones}were put in the 1650's.Also it has a nice stone stile by the gate.The lych-gate is not used now because the path from the school is overgrown and the school has closed down.The church has{5 bells about 270 yrs old which are now being restored.
